derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin digestio(n-), from the verb digerere (see digest)

entry.def: Digestion is the process of digesting food.

example.ex: No liquids are served with meals because they interfere with digestion.
example.tran: 上饭菜时不要同时上汤水或饮品，因为这会影响消化。

entry.def: Your digestion is the system in your body which digests your food.

example.ex: My digestion ain't so hot these days, either.
example.tran: 我的消化系统这几天也不怎么对劲儿。

means.word_mean: 1. the process of decomposing organic matter (as in sewage) by bacteria or by chemical action or heat
2. the organic process by which food is converted into substances that can be absorbed into the body
3. learning and coming to understand ideas and information;

sentences.sentence: "his appetite for facts was better than his digestion"
